results.name: Total number T(n,k) of 1's in falling diagonals with index k in all n X n permutation matrices; triangle T(n,k), n>=1, 1-n<=k<=n-1, read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) is the number of occurrences of k in all (signed) displacement lists [p(i)-i, i=1..n] of permutations p of [n].
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..100, flattened
formula: T(n,k) = (n-t)*(n-1)! if t < n with t = |k|, T(n,k) = 0 otherwise.
E.g.f. of column k: x^t/t * hypergeom([2, t], [t+1], x) with t = |k|+1.
example: The 6 permutations p of [3]: 123, 132, 213, 231, 312, 321 have (signed) displacement lists [p(i)-i, i=1..3]: [0,0,0], [0,1,-1], [1,-1,0], [1,1,-2], [2,-1,-1], [2,0,-2], representing the indices of falling diagonals of 1's in the permutation matrices
[    1]  [  1  ]  [    1]  [1    ]  [  1  ]  [1    ] , respectively. Indices -2 and 2 occur twice, -1 and 1 occur four times, and 0 occurs six times. So row n=3 is [2, 4, 6, 4, 2].
